title: Calculating Total Circuit R (Parallel)

questions.prompt:
Using the rated resistance values in the circuit shown above,
what is the circuit's total resistance?

options.option: [var R1 = r1.nominalResistance; var R2 = r2.nominalResistance; var R3 = r3.nominalResistance;Math.toSigFigs(1/(1/R1+1/R2+1/R3),3)] ohms
options.feedback: That's right! You used the correct formula to calculate the total resistance of resistors in parallel.

options.option: [var R1 = r1.nominalResistance; var R2 = r2.nominalResistance; var R3 = r3.nominalResistance;Math.toSigFigs((R1+R2+R3)/3,3)] ohms
options.feedback: You need to use the formula for parallel resistances. Check the tutorial if you need help.

options.option: [var R1 = r1.nominalResistance; var R2 = r2.nominalResistance; var R3 = r3.nominalResistance; 1000*(1/R1+1/R2+1/R3)] ohms
options.feedback: You seem to have made a slight error in the formula for parallel resistances. Check the tutorial if you need help.

options.option: [var R1 = r1.nominalResistance; var R2 = r2.nominalResistance; var R3 = r3.nominalResistance;Math.toSigFigs(R1+R2+R3,3)] ohms
options.feedback: Oops! You used the formula for series resistances. These resistors are in parallel. Check out the tutorial, if this isn't clear.

options.option: [var R1 = r1.nominalResistance; var R2 = r2.nominalResistance; var R3 = r3.nominalResistance;Math.toSigFigs(Math.PI*2/(1/R1+1/R2+1/R3),3)] ohms
options.feedback: You need to use the formula for parallel resistances. Check the tutorial if you need help.

options.option: [var R1 = r1.nominalResistance; var R2 = r2.nominalResistance; var R3 = r3.nominalResistance;Math.toSigFigs(Math.PI/(1/R1+1/R2+1/R3)/3,3)] ohms
options.feedback: That's close, but not correct. Check your math, or maybe the tutorial can help.

options.option: [var R1 = r1.nominalResistance; var R2 = r2.nominalResistance; var R3 = r3.nominalResistance;Math.toSigFigs(10.314*(R1+R2+R3),3)] ohms
options.feedback: You need to use the formula for parallel resistances. Check the tutorial if you need help.

options.option: [var R1 = r1.nominalResistance; var R2 = r2.nominalResistance; var R3 = r3.nominalResistance;Math.toSigFigs(10.314/(1/R1+1/R2+1/R3),3)] ohms
options.feedback: Did you make a mistake with the multipliers for k-ohms or M-ohms?

questions.prompt:
What is the current the battery will supply?
(Hint: Use the total resistance from above.)

options.option: [var R1 = r1.nominalResistance; var R2 = r2.nominalResistance; var R3 = r3.nominalResistance;Math.toSigFigs(9*(1/R1+1/R2+1/R3),3)] A
options.feedback: That's right! The circuit current is just the battery voltage divided by the total resistance.

options.option: [var R1 = r1.nominalResistance; var R2 = r2.nominalResistance; var R3 = r3.nominalResistance;Math.toSigFigs(1/(1/R1+1/R2+1/R3)/9000,3)] A
options.feedback: You seem to be making an error using the formula for calculating current. Check out the tutorial, if this isn't clear.
No, you must use the total resistance value to make this calculation, not just R1. Check out the tutorial, if this isn't clear.
No, you must use the total resistance value to make this calculation, not just R2. Check out the tutorial, if this isn't clear.
No, you must use the total resistance value to make this calculation, not just R3. Check out the tutorial, if this isn't clear.

options.option: [var R1 = r1.nominalResistance; var R2 = r2.nominalResistance; var R3 = r3.nominalResistance;Math.toSigFigs(9/(R1+R2+R3),3)] A
options.feedback: No, you must use the total parallel resistance value, not series, to make this calculation. Check out the tutorial, if this isn't clear.

options.option: [var R1 = r1.nominalResistance; var R2 = r2.nominalResistance; var R3 = r3.nominalResistance;Math.toSigFigs(27/(R1+R2+R3),3)] A
options.feedback: No, you must use the formula for the total parallel resistance value to make this calculation. Check out the tutorial, if this isn't clear.

options.option: [var R1 = r1.nominalResistance; var R2 = r2.nominalResistance; var R3 = r3.nominalResistance;Math.toSigFigs(0.9*(1/R1+1/R2+1/R3)*(1+Math.random()/10),3)] A
options.feedback: Ooops! The value is close, but did you use the wrong multiplier for the units? Check out the tutorial, if this isn't clear.

pages.notes:
For this circuit:
   R1 = [r1.nominalResistance] ohms
   R2 = [r2.nominalResistance] ohms
   R3 = [r3.nominalResistance] ohms
   E = 9.00 volts

COMMENT: Max score 20pts: 10 pts. for R, + 10 pts for I
